question: It is true that wastewater is used water that needs treatment before being released back into the environment.
It is false that wastewater comes only from industrial sources.
It is true that domestic wastewater includes toilet water, kitchen waste, and laundry water.
It is false that industrial wastewater does not contain any harmful chemicals.
It is true that textile industries release dyes and chemicals into wastewater.
It is false that paper industries do not contribute to wastewater pollution.
It is true that untreated wastewater can cause water pollution.
It is false that untreated wastewater improves soil fertility.
It is true that toxic wastewater can degrade soil quality.
It is false that air pollution is not related to wastewater.
It is true that untreated sewage can make rivers and lakes unfit for drinking.
It is false that wastewater cannot cause diseases in humans.
It is true that drinking contaminated water can cause cholera and typhoid.
It is false that toxic chemicals in wastewater have no effect on human health.
It is true that a sewage treatment plant (STP) is used to clean wastewater before releasing it into the environment.
It is false that sewage treatment plants do not remove bacteria from wastewater.
It is true that screening is the first step in a sewage treatment plant.
It is false that grit removal is not necessary in wastewater treatment.
It is true that primary treatment in an STP removes solid waste and floating grease.
It is false that bacteria are used in secondary treatment to break down organic waste.
It is true that tertiary treatment removes harmful bacteria and disinfects the water.
It is false that final discharge from an STP is released without any treatment.
It is true that CPCB has set rules for sewage discharge to prevent water pollution.
It is false that CPCB norms allow untreated sewage to be discharged into rivers.
It is true that the permissible pH level for sewage discharge is between 6.5 and 9.0.
It is false that biochemical oxygen demand (BOD) in sewage should be more than 30 mg/L.
It is true that chemical oxygen demand (COD) should be less than 250 mg/L for safe sewage discharge.
It is false that total suspended solids (TSS) in sewage can be higher than 100 mg/L.
It is true that oil and grease in wastewater should be less than 10 mg/L.
It is false that fecal coliform levels in sewage discharge can be above 1000 MPN/100mL.
It is true that untreated wastewater harms aquatic life.
It is false that wastewater cannot be reused after treatment.
It is true that treated wastewater can be used for irrigation.
It is false that industries do not need to follow sewage treatment regulations.
It is true that industries must treat their wastewater before releasing it.
It is false that sewage treatment is only required for large cities.
It is true that sewage treatment can help in water conservation.
It is false that all sewage treatment plants use the same method.
It is true that proper wastewater management helps in preventing diseases.
It is false that wastewater does not contribute to environmental pollution.
It is true that CPCB sets norms to regulate sewage disposal in India.
It is false that wastewater does not need treatment before being discharged into rivers.
It is true that untreated industrial waste is a major cause of water pollution.
It is false that sewage treatment removes all pollutants completely.
It is true that wastewater treatment plants help protect marine ecosystems.
It is false that untreated wastewater has no effect on human health.
It is true that proper sewage treatment reduces waterborne diseases.
It is false that wastewater cannot be recycled for any purpose.
It is true that public awareness is important for better wastewater management.
It is false that wastewater treatment is not necessary in modern cities.
